markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Lamellar Breastplate](/Armor.aspx?ID=26)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Hindering" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=479" />
<trait label="Laminar" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=482" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 10 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 7 gp

**AC Bonus** +4

**Dex Cap** +1

**Check Penalty** -2

**Speed Penalty** -5 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 16

**Bulk** 2

**Category** Medium

**Group** Composite
</row>

</column>

---

Slats of lacquered steel or other metal held together with cord, whether leather or silk, make up most lamellar breastplates. The lacquering prevents the metal from corroding.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-2" />
name: Lamellar Breastplate
